Jailed drug trafficker Han Zhang fails in bid to remain in New Zealand https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/jailed-drug-trafficker-han-zhang-fails-bid-to-remain-in-new-zealand/OZMTWVYBFBH4FMCDHUFXR7JRBM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/jailed-drug-trafficker-han-zhang-fails-bid-to-remain-in-new-zealand/OZMTWVYBFBH4FMCDHUFXR7JRBM/ Jeremy WilkinsonHan Zhang, who imported drugs and tobacco, wanted to remain in NZ to be close to his son. Patching over: King Cobras defect to Comancheros as gang expands into rival’s turf in Auckland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/patching-over-king-cobras-defect-to-comancheros-as-gang-expands-into-rivals-turf-in-auckland/IED4OKIJCFFNPDNAXPDYFTTDKU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/patching-over-king-cobras-defect-to-comancheros-as-gang-expands-into-rivals-turf-in-auckland/IED4OKIJCFFNPDNAXPDYFTTDKU/ Jared Savage, George BlockComanchero takeover could inflame tensions in volatile gang sceneSat, 27 Jul 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The new central Auckland chapter of the notorious international outlaw gang the Comanchero Motorcycle Club (CMC) announced their arrival with this post on a private social media page, shared widely in the underworld. The ACCA acronym features in many Comanchero tattoos, clothing items and social media posts - the pledge stands for "Always Comancheros, Comancheros Always". The 1% denotes outlaw motorcycle clubs, who embrace the term "one percenters" alluding to a comment by a former president of the American Motorcyclist Association (AMA) who said 99 percent of riders were law-biding while the remainder were outlaws.
